title: `libproc_macro` rust interface
body:
We require a rust interface for our future `libproc_macro` library we will bind using ffi to our c++ version of the `libproc_macro`.

Here are the components required:

- [x] [Delimiter](https://doc.rust-lang.org/proc_macro/enum.Delimiter.html)
- [x] [Group](https://doc.rust-lang.org/proc_macro/struct.Group.html)
- [x] [Ident](https://doc.rust-lang.org/proc_macro/struct.Ident.html)
- [x] [LexError](https://doc.rust-lang.org/proc_macro/struct.LexError.html)
- [x] [Literal](https://doc.rust-lang.org/proc_macro/struct.Literal.html)
- [x] [Punct](https://doc.rust-lang.org/proc_macro/struct.Punct.html)
- [x] [Spacing](https://doc.rust-lang.org/proc_macro/enum.Spacing.html)
- [x] [Span](https://doc.rust-lang.org/proc_macro/struct.Span.html)
- [x] [TokenStream](https://doc.rust-lang.org/proc_macro/struct.TokenStream.html)
- [x] [TokenTree](https://doc.rust-lang.org/proc_macro/enum.TokenTree.html)
- [x] [is_available](https://doc.rust-lang.org/proc_macro/fn.is_available.html)
- [x] [token_stream](https://doc.rust-lang.org/proc_macro/token_stream/index.html)


Additional things to achieve:

- [x] Rework `Clone` trait on string owning types. We may want to do deep clone instead of copying the fields with a new alloc and `memcpy` of the internal string.
- [x] Add byte length as argument in FFI C interface ? Rust string are not null terminated.

Implement the following traits for most types that require it. We may create a new issue for this as Sync and Send traits are not working yet with gccrs. We can use the marker trait for most structures, however enumerations will require a nightly feature.

- [ ] `!Sync` for most types
- [ ] `!Send` for most types
